@drewcula 

Here's what senior pirates know a long time about false postives and what to do:

In case the crack is detected by your av software you'll need to add the crack 
to the exclusions list from your av software. Exclude the crack from being 
real-time protected and auto-scanned by your av software. Also exclude the 
crack which is copied to the installation directory of the program, otherwise 
you won't be able to run the program. You may need to turn off your av software 
temporarily to be able to add the crack to the av exclusions list.

Unfortunately this didn't work for me because my OS is 64 bit. :(  Got anything for Advanced PDF Tools 2.0?  Everything I've tried has been a virus.

Microsoft Security Essentials detected:

VirTool:Win32/Obfuscator

These are detections for programs that have had their purpose obfuscated to hinder analysis or  detection by anti-virus scanners. They commonly employ a combination of methods including encryption, compression, anti-debugging and anti-emulation techniques.

These obfuscation techniques are used on various kinds of malware. The malware that lies "underneath" may have virtually any purpose.

MSE has only detected "real" threats. If MSE says "no good", then I don't play.

Use at your own risk.

It worked for like a year or longer for me.. until AVG got an update and now sees this as a virus.. :S
